alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Gaines (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 12:42AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GAINES...BORDEN... NORTHWESTERN HOWARD...NORTHEASTERN MARTIN AND DAWSON COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM CDT... At 1242 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Grassland to 19 miles west of Lamesa. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamesa, Ackerly, Gail, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Welch, Los Ybanez, Sparenberg, Punkin Center, Patricia, Arvana, Hancock, McKenzie Lake, Tenmile, Key, and Klondike. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
